poem:
**Frankie Archer**

In the silence of Northumbria,
she conjures old bones to dance
with electric ghosts.

Her violin becomes a storm,
a buzzing hive, a clock

ticking us closer to
some new story,
half-spoken under her breath,

each note a step into fog,
each song, an echo in the future.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "One to watch: Frankie Archer Frankie Archer is a singer of traditional folk songs with a twist: her musical palette is influenced by Björk, Hannah Peel, Rosalía and James Blake. Performing simply and plainly in her Northumbrian accent, she uses synthesisers and electronics to layer atmosphere into her arrangements, even submitting her violin to an array of distorting effects pedals (on recent single Lovely Joan, it sounds like a sinister electric guitar). Although her parents". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
